discovery_rule.name: Discovery disk names

item_prototype.name: Disk {#DNAME}: $1
item_prototype.description: Percentage of CPU time during which I/O requests were issued to the device (bandwidth utilization for the device). Device saturation occurs when this value is close to 100%.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#DNAME}: $1
item_prototype.description: The average time (in milliseconds) for I/O requests issued to the device to be served. This includes the time spent by the requests in queue and the time spent servicing them

item_prototype.name: Disk {#DNAME}: $1
item_prototype.description: The number of read requests that were issued to the device per second.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#DNAME}: $1
item_prototype.description: The number of read requests that were issued to the device per second.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#DNAME}: $1
item_prototype.description: Indicate the amount of data read from the drive expressed in bytes per second.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#DNAME}: $1
item_prototype.description: Indicate the amount of data write to the drive expressed in bytes per second.

discovery_rule.name: Discovery smart device names
discovery_rule.description:
Can be used in typical configuration: smartctl --info /dev/name return: SMART support is: Enabled
When smartctl need definition for device type, you have to use separate template on host

item_prototype.name: Disk $2: $1
item_prototype.description: Count of reallocated sectors. When the hard drive finds a read/write/verification error, it marks that sector as "reallocated" and transfers data to a special reserved area (spare area). This process is also known as remapping, and reallocated sectors are called "remaps". The raw value normally represents a count of the bad sectors that have been found and remapped.

item_prototype.name: Disk $2: $1
item_prototype.description: Rate of seek errors of the magnetic heads. If there is a partial failure in the mechanical positioning system, then seek errors will arise. Such a failure may be due to numerous factors, such as damage to a servo, or thermal widening of the hard disk.

item_prototype.name: Disk $2: $1
item_prototype.description: Stores data related to the rate of hardware read errors that occurred when reading data from a disk surface. The raw value has different structure for different vendors and is often not meaningful as a decimal number
